intro: Paliavana gracilis, commonly known as the slender paliavana, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often near streams or in forest understories. It has a slender, herbaceous stem that can reach up to 1 meter in height. Due to its unique appearance and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
